name: First Conditional
explanation: Used for real and possible future situations. Exams test tense sequence errors in if-clauses.
structure: If + present simple, will + base verb

questions.question: If she ____ hard, she will succeed.

name: Second Conditional
explanation: Used for unreal or hypothetical present/future situations.
structure: If + past simple, would + base verb

questions.question: If I ____ you, I would apologize.

name: Third Conditional
explanation: Used for unreal situations in the past (regret or imagination).
structure: If + had + past participle, would have + past participle

questions.question: If she ____ harder, she would have won.

name: Mixed Conditionals
explanation: Mixed conditionals combine different time frames (past cause + present result).
structure: If + had + past participle, would + base verb

questions.question: If she had studied medicine, she ____ a doctor now.

name: Subjunctive Mood
explanation: Subjunctive expresses wishes, demands, or hypothetical situations. Use 'were' for all subjects.
structure: If I were... | It is important that he be...

questions.question: If I ____ you, I would leave.

name: Inversion after Negative Adverbs
explanation: After negative adverbs (Never, Rarely), we invert subject and auxiliary.
